message.content:
cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.HC, cs.CY 

This paper deals with the problem of automatic generation of informative expertise summary or taglines for Twitter experts in space constraint imposed by UI design. It proposes three methods for expertise summary generation with use of knowledge-enhanced computing approaches. The study has implications in the area of expert profiling, user presentation and application design for engaging user experience. Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as the paper deals with social media and user presentation. The second likely category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as the paper deals with generating informative summaries. The third likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language) as the paper proposes methods for expertise summary generation. The fourth likely category is cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) as the paper deals with application design for engaging user experience. The fifth likely category is cs.CY (Computers and Society) as the paper has implications in the area of expert profiling.
